title: The Keeper of the Key
tagline: A ghost, a key, and a river of memories: a photographer must develop the past to save her father's soul.
themes: Photography as a Medium for Ghosts
Love as an Unfinished Conversation with the Dead
Mortality as a Shared Journey Across Generations

chapters.title: The First Thing the Ghost Did
The Scent of Phở at Dawn

story: Write a scene where a character receives a mundane object from a ghost, charged with a specific, unspoken memory.
Create a conversation between a dying elder and a restless ancestor, mediated by a skeptical younger family member.
Describe a journey through a modern Asian city where the protagonist sees literal 'ghosts' of its colonial past in the architecture and street life.
Craft a myth where the River of Forgetfulness requires a photograph as the toll for passage, instead of a coin.
technical: Build an interactive website where users can 'develop' a ghostly image by hovering over different parts of a photographic negative.
Create a text generator that blends Vietnamese poetic forms (like lục bát) with descriptions of photographic development chemicals and processes.

cover_prompt: A spectral woman, her form woven from swirling river water and old photographic silver, reaches a translucent hand towards a living photographer who holds a large-format camera, their connection forming a bridge between worlds on a misty riverbank at dusk. The scene is set where a colonial-era pier meets a dark, slow-moving tropical river, with ghostly negatives of forgotten ancestors floating like water lilies and the roots of ancient banyan trees cradling old, submerged camera parts, all under a sky the color of a faded cyanotype. In the profoundly atmospheric and mythic style of Zdzisław Beksiński's haunting surrealism and the melancholic, layered storytelling of Gregory Crewdson's photographic tableaux, evoking a sense of deep, inherited memory. Book cover framing, centered and symmetrical composition with a low, dramatic angle looking up slightly at the two figures, emphasizing the river as a vast, reflective plane. Ethereal, volumetric lighting cuts through the mist with a cool, moonlight temperature, contrasting with the warm, amber glow emanating from the key hanging from the photographer's neck, using a palette of desaturated blues, silvers, and deep blacks punctuated by sepia and gold. masterpiece, best quality, ultra detailed, intricate details, professional composition, sharp focus, 8k resolution, flux dev.
